In section 3.1, we describe the evolutionary process arising from this limit across the six introduced dynamics and derive exact expressions for single mutant fixation probabilities under any network of communities . We further analyze these contributions under the general social dilemma section, which is complemented by the content in appendix B . In this section, we analyze the extent to which these rules are valid outside of the limits of large networks .

In this context, we show that whether a strategy evolves or not depends on the advantage it holds against other strategies in two contexts: when in homogeneous groups and when in within-community fixation processes . In the context of the HD dilemma, we find that a conflict between cooperating as a socially best strategy, i.e. a Pareto optimal one, and defecting as an individually best strategy . This is in line with what is observed in alternative community and deme models .
